para: The Layer list in the Graphics window usually only shows the primary &layers;: those that show &images;, &skels;, and &meshes;. It does not show the predefined &layers; for pixel selections, Skeleton selections, &actives;, etc. In order to modify (or delete) the predefined layers in the GUI, it's necessary first to select them. In order to select them, it's necessary to turn on List_All_Layers.
List_All_Layers has no effect in scripts or in text mode. In GUI mode, unlisted layers are indicated by thin horizontal lines in the layer list, as shown in .

caption.para: The top image shows the Graphics Window's Layer List when List_All_Layers is off. The arrows mark the faint lines denoting the unlisted &layers;. The bottom image shows a portion of the list when List_All_Layers is on. It is necessary to scroll to see the whole list. Most of the &layers; are predefined auxiliary &layers; not normally displayed. At this position in the list, only one of the normally listed layers (indicated by the pink box) is visible.
